title: Seared Sesame Tuna
summary: Seared Sesame Tuna might be just the main course you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains roughly 44g of protein, 15g of fat, and a total of 354 calories. For $7.01 per serving, this recipe covers 41% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 2. If you have spring onions, cucumber, chilli, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. It is brought to you by BBC Good Food. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 15 minutes. Overall, this recipe earns a tremendous spoonacular score of 94%. Sesame Seared Tuna, Seared Sesame-crusted Tuna, and Black Sesame Seared Tuna are very similar to this recipe.

winePairing.pairingText: Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine are great choices for Tuna. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. You could try Enate Cabernet Sauvignon Merlot. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 19 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Enate Cabernet Sauvignon Merlot
productMatches.description: Fully ruby color. A complex blackcurrant, blackberry aroma with a touch of violet and hints of red pepper, vanilla and herbs. Smooth and round mouthfeel; the soft tannic cushion gives way to a flavorsome palate which releases pleasant honey-roast aromas. The well-balanced acidity will ensure improvement in the bottle over the next five years.
